page.title: 13GIRL GUIDES IN BLAGDON
page.content: I am a member of the guides and go every Thursday from 7.30 until 9.00. We have to pay a pound every month as our 'subs'. Mrs Mainwaring is our Guider. We play 'bulldogs','broom game','caterpillar race' etc. Our uniform is a blue skirt and shirt and a green scarf and blue hat with a badge sewn on above the left eye. We go to guides to serve the Queen and help other people. We learn how to make camp fires when we go trecking every other Thursday. We have to collect dry wood and we take food to cook. First we have to ask the farmer for permission to go on his land. At the end of the evening we sing a song called 'Taps':- { "DAY'S DONE,GONE THE SUN,FROM THE {SEA, FROM THE HILLS, FROM THE SKY. ALL {IS WELL SAFELY REST, GOD IS NIGH."
